body:
Hello there,

I am doing some Glare analysis for which it would be fundamental to model water properly.

I am having difficulties to  input the materials definitions I have found in this [Link](http://www.arch.mcgill.ca/prof/reinhart/software/Radiance/HowToModelWater.html) in the honeybee library, I think I am formatting the string not properly,

Any suggestion?

Thanks!

replies.body: Hi Amedeo, You can do it as simple as adding the materials to the library and apply them to surfaces. Just make sure to create the wave.cal file and copy it inside c:\radiance\lib. Here is the results: [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/hydra_1/master/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee/water_cube_IMG_Perspective.PNG) [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/hydra_1/master/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee_GH.png) Check this Hydra for one of the approaches mentioned in the link: ([http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&amp...;](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee))

Hi Mostapha,
Thank you for this post, We all proud of you.
For one educational project, I am trying to evaluate the effect of thick water wall on daylight distribution inside a room. (as you know it is not possible with glass material) this water wall is oriented to the south with thickness about 25 cm. I have defined a dielectric material in radiance for Water as this: void dielectric Water 0 0 5 0.8695 0.8695 0.8695 1.33 0 #red_transmissivity  green_transmissivity   blue_transmissivity   index_of_refraction   0 Therefore, I defined 2 surfaces for front and back and since there is just one layer of dielectric, I don't need using any interface material. But the direction of these surface is very tricky. both directions have to be toward outside (?) should I rotate them inside in reverse ray tracing???  The resultant values are significantly different. any comments would be really helpful for me. 
thanks in advance.
